alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 6:41PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 945 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM HST, radar indicated slow moving showers with locally heavy rain over portions of the North Kona and South Kohala Districts. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Waikoloa Village, Puuanahulu, Holualoa, Kalaoa, Honalo, Pohakuloa Training Area, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Waikoloa Beach, Waikii, Mauna Lani and Kona International Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 945 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
